Articles.Content:
Okay the challenge here to to make an orbital drop pod that that drops a vehicle of some sort onto a planets surface. The pod is not allowed to leave the surface after landing and should deploy a single vehicle. The vehicle must be fully contained in a mark 3 bay.

You will be judged on 3 categories: cost, Size, and coolness factor. I will mark down the highest scorers in each category below. Pictures are required for the coolness factor category and because I want to see what others have come up with. For the first so categories lower is better.

Cost:

1. MiffedStarFish - 60,490

2.

3.

4.

5.

 

Size:

1. MiffedStarFish - 76

2.

3.

4.

5.

 

Coolness Factor

1. MiffedStarFish - PREPARE FOR TITANFALL

2. DoctorDavinci

3.

4.

5.

It has stock hinge landing legs, and holds a plane with folding wings.

https://imgur.com/MV4uizd

https://imgur.com/wA8EUAi

https://shadowgoat128134.imgur.com/all/

The landing legs spread enough for the plane to be able to take off without bumping them.

Edited November 18, 2017 by ShadowGoat
*mild disappointment at lack of replies*

Don't be impatient. Sometimes it takes a couple of days for people to decide to enter a challenge.

And, if no one enters, try again with something different.
Would a 2.5m form factor be acceptable?  Is the Mk3 cargo bay restriction on the vehicle after deployment from the drop pod or on the drop pod itself?

How is cost determined? I ask because I sent a small craft to Duna as part of a much larger mission.

First the mother ship was assembled using parts launched in a Mk3 heavy lifter space plane, then the entire mother ship plus lander went off to Duna, then I detached the lander craft and sent it on its way to the surface. It landed on parachutes and deployed a RoveMate-sized rover.

That was fun

Craft File: https://kerbalx.com/DoctorDavinci/MINI

1st question: it applies to the drop pod not the vehicle. The vehicle inside just needs to fit into the bay.

2nd question: it only counts the cost of the DropPod itself not the rest of the vehicle if it's part of a larger mission.

I just watched your video, @DoctorDavinci, and I liked it quite a lot! It took a much different turn from mine, as seen below. Ill add you to the coolness factor leaderboard. Could you please provide the dimensions and cost of the vehicle. BTW, im changing it from part count to size.

Here's mine.

It has stock hinge landing legs, and holds a plane with folding wings.

https://imgur.com/MV4uizd

https://imgur.com/wA8EUAi

https://shadowgoat128134.imgur.com/all/

The landing legs spread enough for the plane to be able to take off without bumping them.

Edited November 13, 2017 by ShadowGoat
I think I’ll try this tomorrow.

On ‎2017‎-‎11‎-‎13 at 4:51 AM, DoctorDavinci said:

That was fun

MINI.......ROVER.....SO.....CUTE.....
Yay. I would love to see what you come up with miffed.

Ok, so I have built the craft and tested it, but Imgur was acting up and I don’t have pictures right now. It drops an... unconventional... vehicle.

(Edit: I’m only 10 likes away from one thousand! That felt quick.)

Edited November 16, 2017 by MiffedStarfish
knowing you it’s probably something crazy so I will be eagerly awaiting seeing what you have made
Btw I gave you your thousandth like

YAY! Thanks! Imgur is working now too, so here is the album!

https://imgur.com/gallery/c61it

Edited November 18, 2017 by MiffedStarfish

LMAO! Part count? Cost? I think you usurped the current first in coolness factor. I would put my self first because I used stock hinges but that would be cheap. TITANFALL!

Also this is from a different universe but

Seid ihr das Essen?
NEIN, WIR SIND DIE YAEGER!
Oh sorry didn't see that bit. 76 parts, 60,940 funds.
Well you win all 3 category's for the time being encase doctordavinci didn't provide those stats
On it! Let me try...
What mods, if any, are allowed?
Preferably stock. But I guess some mods would be okay as long as they don't make the game unrecognizable part wise.
